name: Home ?
body:
### I'm learning about things
This page is a testament to that.  Today I'm learning how to publish a Github Page and markdown. Ideally, this can serve as a presentable way to share things I'm working on.  

One of my favorite projects recently is our [Staff Portal](https://github.com/FocusedOne/StaffPortal).  It's pretty basic but is somehow the 5th most popular page on our website.  Considering it's only used by 120 people, I'm fairly proud of that.

Recently, we needed a quick iframe container for a registration form, so I re-used the header, menu and footer from the [Staff Portal](https://github.com/FocusedOne/StaffPortal) on our ["Welcome Home"](https://github.com/FocusedOne/GatherAgain)page.

I've refined these pages as I've learned more about HTML and CSS.  Every website I've dealt with in the past 13ish years has been Wordpress based, so it's refreshing and fun to re-learn how to create a page in a text editor.  I'm not good at it, but it is enjoyable.

## Other things I'm learning about
Github is pretty cool.  We (briefly) employed another human who could edit an .htm file.  Attempting to explain my horrific versioning system on the FTP server led me to do versioning on Github.  Now I can edit the site on any device without needing to pull a fresh copy down.  Great success!

I'm also into amateur radio [(NG5P)](https://www.qrz.com/db/NG5P), cameras and bicycles.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
